Jogo muito bom, tem alguns bugs, mas mesmo assim recomendo muito

I mean, I think this game is really fun don't get me wrong. But I spent maybe half an hour to an hour sometimes waiting for an entire lobby to fill up. It may be because of the ratio of people playing killers to people playing survivors, I have no idea but it is really outrageous to have to wait that long for a lobby to fill up. Not only that, but the people I usually end up playing with are extremely laggy and take forever to load, sometimes even disconnecting entirely. It's even worse if I'm playing as a killer because if even one person somehow disconnects, pretty much everyone leaves.... Overall though, very fun. Scares me senseless playing as survivor as I always seem to have the luck of ending up near the killer XD. I recommend playing kill your friends mostly though because that way, you don't have to wait for lobbies. But if you are thinking about buying this and don't have many friends who play it then you're in for a long time of waiting.

EDIT: Found out this problem was going on during a two times Bloodpoints event, where a lot of people were playing as killers more than survivors. The problem hasn't been happening since the event ended. Usually my wait time is either pretty instant or up to around 3-5 minutes.

This game is a beauty to play that will never cease being addicting. When you first get into it, that adrenaline rush from playing both survivor and killer is something that is hard to find in multiplayer games. Mixing the fear from a great horror based setting and the intensity from competitive play is a fantastic way to keep you engaged and on your toes. 

However with the good still comes the bad. This game suffers from some real balancing issues that keep the game fun on a casual level but remove any sort of competitive satisfaction that other games have. For the most part, survivors and killers are both enjoyable to play, however when both sides play to their full potential, the survivors are favoured tenfold. A simple proof of this is the fact that I've been playing the game for just over a month and consider myself an average player. Yet I was still able to hit rank 1 survivor fairly quickly with no real challenge. As a killer this just isn't the case and you need to be very skilled to get that far. Fixing this balance issue between survivors and killers would make the game that much more fun, fair and immersive.

Still highly recommended though for anyone who wants some spooky fun, especially with friends :p Just dont expect the competitive side of the game to be like others.

This Game is a Love/Hate Relationship. Sometimes you wanna kill yourself after a Trial,
sometimes you feel like a God. Highly recommend this Game.

Dead by Daylight is one of my favourite games ever. I bought the game just over a year ago and have already racked up over 1,100 hours because it‚Äôs so damn addictive to play. The constant improvements and love that the devs give to this game and the community has made it last unlike certain other games *cough* Friday the 13th *cough*, not to mention the new content that comes out every couple of months, introducing badass new killers and survivors, and a beautiful new map. Yes the community is toxic as hell and triggers the s*** out of me from time to time, and it‚Äôs not the most balanced of games, but it doesn‚Äôt stop me from loading it up on a daily basis to have fun.

I do not recommend this game in the current state,

sure it has improved over the years but there are still many bugs, server problems and various crashes which are only fixed after several months.

What is more serious is missing a system capable of identifying and punishing those who use "soft cheats" which has increased dramatically, making the experience somewhat frustrating on many occasions.
